item.description:
Day trip to Willamstown, MA to view the Picasso looks at Degas exhibit at the Clark, have a great lunch and explore the town. This is a carpool trip, meaning that we will need to take as many cars and have as many drivers as needed for the group. I will drive and can take 3 other people (one spot is already taken). When you RSVP, please say if you will drive and how many you can take. I expect we will share the driving in each car, as the trip is 2 and 1/2 hours each way - very scenic along the Mohawk trail (Rte 2)
We may need to limit the attendance once we reach max capacity for the cars. We''l see :)
Plan to meet for departure at 8 a.m. in Concord at the Crosby's Market parking lot neat the Concord Train Depot on Sudbury Road. (Take Rte 2 west, turn right on Sudbury Road and follow to the lot on your right. Park in one of the commuter spots)
We will plan to return to Concord, departing Williamstown around 5 p.m.
Each person will be responsible for own museum admission ($15) and food. Drivers will welcome donations for gas.
Please do not RSVP Yes and then back out at the last minute as others may be depending on you.
Thanks - Robin
item.name: Day trip to Williamstown, MA -" Picasso Looks at Degas" at the Clark and lunch
